# Meaning of **microblogging** in English

microblogging

noun [ U ]

us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˈmaɪ.kroʊˌblɑː.ɡɪŋ/ uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˈmaɪ.krəˌblɒɡ.ɪŋ/

Add to word list __ Add to word list __

the activity of writing microblogs

__SMART Vocabulary: related words and phrases

Writing & typing

(Definition of **microblogging** from the **Cambridge Advanced Learner's
Dictionary & Thesaurus** © Cambridge University Press)

## **microblogging** | Business English

microblogging

noun [ U ]

  COMMUNICATIONS   (also micro-blogging)

uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˈmaɪkrəʊˌblɒɡɪŋ/ us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

Add to word list __ Add to word list __

the activity of sending short messages for anyone to read, especially from a
mobile phone:

She's written several articles on how microblogging can help your business.

(Definition of **microblogging** from the **Cambridge Business English
Dictionary** © Cambridge University Press)

## Examples of microblogging

microblogging

Via acquisitions, we know _microblogging_ network definitely considers
analytics as a possible monetization opportunity.

From TechCrunch __

The market became enamored with _microblogging_ and activity stream technology
over the past few years.

From TechCrunch __

The leader's speech regularly provokes arguments among the armchair analysts
on the nation's most popular _microblogging_ sites.

From Slate Magazine __

While blogging typically resides in the upper echelons of the social media
hierarchy, _microblogging_ is extending the ability to create beyond the
elite.

From Fast Company __

From cries of outrage to expressions of support for the jury's decision,
people across the _microblogging_ social network had a ton to say.

From International Business Times __

Furthermore, a segment between _microblogging_ and micromedia has opened up an
entirely new class of content sharing.

From Fast Company __

A hashtag is used to narrow down tweets on a particular topic in the
_microblogging_ site.

From CNN __

Twitter's _microblogging_ format, capping tweets at 140 characters, was
perfect for this type of situation.

From Huffington Post __

The _microblogging_ service said its user base ticked up 3 percent to 317
million average monthly active users in the third quarter from 313 million in
the second quarter.

From Huffington Post __

The revolution-enabling _microblogging_ platform just hasn't been all that
revolutionary in terms of its own product, and user growth and confidence from
wall street have slowed as a result.

From TechCrunch __

We spread the invitation over e-mail, blogs, _microblogging_ and social
networks.

From the Cambridge English Corpus __

These examples are from corpora and from sources on the web. Any opinions in
the examples do not represent the opinion of the Cambridge Dictionary editors
or of Cambridge University Press or its licensors.

What is the pronunciation of _microblogging_? __



B1

Word of the Day

optical illusion

UK

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˌɒp.tɪ.kəl ɪˈluː.ʒən/

US

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˌɑːp.tɪ.kəl ɪˈluː.ʒən/

something that tricks your eyes and makes you think you see something that is
not really there, or see it differently from how it really is
